content.description: Some loose rock is encountered on this route.
content.location: This is approximately 50 feet right of Stone Master and is the obvious west facing chimney.  There is some looseness.

content.description: Up the crack to a fixed pin at the top, move right about ten feet and head up the large crack system.
content.location: This is about 25 feet right of previous route in an obvious and appealing crack system.  A recent look at it revealed that it is dripping with bat shit in one part, hence the one star rating.  If clean it would make for a two star climb.

content.description: Climb the cool slab past four bolts and then over and around a giant overhang that tops the slab.  Neat rock and moves.
content.protection: five or six bolts, wires and a few cams to 2"
content.location: This is ten feet from the start of the previous route and is to the right of the arete.

content.description: Up the dihedral and crack for 25 feet and then follow two bolts up to a little bulge and arete-like feature.  More gear up her too.  The rock is gold and so solid.  Anchor at the top
content.location: About five feet right of Unliely in a dihedral with crack.

content.description: Climb delicately up whitish, featured rock to a bolt at 25 feet.  Follow bolts and place gear up more whitish rock until the rock improves and turns golden.
content.location: This route begins about 40 or 50 feet right of the chimney

content.description: Climb up knobby featured rock at about 5.5 or 5.6 and just left of the arete.  The crux is getting past the two bolts.
content.protection: two bolts, a few small wires, and 1/2" to 2" cams
content.location: Ten feet right of Unbeknowst and just left of a little arete.

content.description: Up the featured face to first bolt at 20 feet (5.7 or so, so PG13?).  Pass two bolts at 5.10a to a ledge.  Straight up on gear to overhang and two bolts (crux).  Up to top using gear.
content.protection: four bolts and gear, cams and nuts to 2"
content.location: The featured face 30 feet right of previous route.

content.description: Start in the crack then move onto face to the left and past a bolt.  Find your way to a second bolt and the top.
content.protection: two bolts and cams up to 4"
content.location: Start in a wide crack about 40 feet right of Stonemaster.

content.description: A decent little route with good gear.  take the ledge to the west to descend or rap off tree to right.
content.location: This route and the ones to its right are on the second sector of Loiterland.  This route is approximately 100 feet to the right of Unreliable of the Goldbar sector.

content.description: Up the crack for 15 feet and then head right to bolt.  Up past more bolts and gear.  Crux is passing second and the third bolts.  There is an easier 5.6 variation start about ten feet to the right of the crack start and goes up a protectable crack to first bolt.
content.protection: bolts and gear.  Cams up to 4"
content.location: Starts in Un-Yun crack

content.description: The crux is moving past the second bolt.  The start of this route is runout to the first bolt but it is on cool knobby and featured rock.  it is perhaps 5.7 to the bolt at 25 feet.
content.location: Start this route about ten feet right of the left and then right trending crack.

content.description: Climb the crack and then continue up past a bolt (at 30 feet) and to a ledge.  Straight up past several more bolts and gear, over a bulge and the crux, to the top and an anchor.
content.protection: bolts and gear including a selection or wires and cams, one set 1/2" to 4", perhaps a larger piece as well.
content.location: This is about 30 feet right of West Chimney, at a nice crack leading to a face.

content.description: This is a Loiterland classic.  Pass two bolts on lower angled rock to horizontal zone and then engage the overhanging block to glory.  Classic.
content.location: The start is about 20 feet right around the arete from Jedi Master.

content.description: Up West Chimney about ten feet and traverse right toward bolt on face to the right.  It's a cruxy move at first bolt.  The hanger is currently missing from this bolt.  Head up and past three more bolts and gear with the crux moving past the last one.
content.protection: four bolts and a few cams up to 2"
content.location: This starts in West Chimney.

content.description: Not a good route though could provide access to the top for setting up an anchor on another route.

Move up and right about ten feet to just left of the arete.  Continue upward and move back and forth on the opposite sides of the arete and belay in the horizontal zone on the right side of the arete.  Pitch two follows five more bolts on a leftward trajectory over very steep rock.
content.protection: mostly bolts.  supplement with 1" to 2" cams
content.location: This route is found on the Unbalanced Rock sector of Loiterland.  It begins about 100 feet to the right of Direct Crack on top of a flat block against the wall.  It is very identifiable by its smooth faces and shallow arete.  Very aesthetic rock.  It appears that the bolts on the route have been recently upgraded for the send.

content.description: This is a sustained route.  Up features to bolt at 15'.  Move up and right and then over a little overhang.  Now head slightly up and left following four bolts (sustained) and gear.  Two bolt anchor.  Beautiful.
content.location: Start 10 feet right of Gold Bar Center.

content.description: Pass the two bolts and up and over the overlap to a ledge.  Now shoot up the arete, following bolts and eventually move around the arete to the right and finish out the route.  Beautiful.  Quality.
content.location: 15 feet right of Golddigger and identify two closely placed bolts.

content.description: The first bolt is 15' up, and this is rated about 5.9 to get there. A stickclip would be handy.  wo more bolts gets one established on a ledge. The crux is after the third bolt. From the ledgy area, pass three more bolts in the golden rock with the opportunity for small (1/2") to 3" cam placements.
content.protection: Bolts, cams (1/2" to 3"), and a selection of half a dozen is sufficient.
content.location:
It is 10 to 15 feet right of the start to

Goldbar Left Edge

.

content.description: Ascend 20' to the first bolt using a stickclip? Climb up to a ledgy area and around to the left of the left edge of the face proper. This is somewhat dirty and lichen covered. It could clean up with traffic and be a decent route at a lower grade.
content.protection: One bolt, a few wires, and a small selection of cams from small to 3".

content.description:
The first crux is getting through the overhand, and the second crux is past the second bolt above. Eventually, move left to exit into the top of the previous route,

Black Streak

.
content.protection: 5 or six bolts and a small set of cams 1 to 4".
content.location:
Start near

Black Streak

, and go straight up and over the at the largest part of the overhang.

content.description: An ok route if you have nothing better to do.
content.location: 5 feet right of previous crack.

content.description:
The crux is passing the the third bolt in the overlaps/overhang which 10c or d. The featured rock at the start is whitish so dusty and a little crumbly, but it is not too difficult. Move up and left on good features to a bolt at about 20 feet. Above the overhang, move leftward to several more bolts, and finish on

Goldbar Left

.
content.location:
Find the start about 30' right of

Goldbar Left

. It starts a few feet right of a little ten foot tall dihedral.
